Headline: Miley Cyrus gave a haunting 'SNL' performance
Article_Body: Miley Cyrus, please give us an acoustic album.  The singer/actress appeared on the latest at-home "Saturday Night Live" episode this weekend and gave a strong acoustic performance of the 1975 Pink Floyd classic "Wish You Were Here." Cyrus performed next to a fire pit, the glow of which added to the poignancy of the song, whose lyrics include, "Did they get you to trade/Your heroes for ghosts?/Hot ashes for trees? Hot air for a cool breeze?" She was joined by guitarist Andrew Watt, who appeared to be a safe social distance from Cyrus while they performed. In March, Watt revealed on his Instagram account that he had been diagnosed with Covid-19.  It wasn't Cyrus's first time taking on a Pink Floyd tune. In 2019, she sang the band's "Comfortably Numb" at the iHeartRadio Music Festival in Las Vegas.
